page.title: 01Farmland SE of Newport
page.content: Highland in the SW of the block slopes down from 137m towards the NE. Here the valley of the Back Brook marks the Shropshire-Staffordshire border. This valley is a drained marsh with black peaty soil. Small knolls protrude out of the flat land. The higher ground comprises sands and clays. Small woods and coppices are scattered over the area. The block is dominated by mixed farming. Arable farming is predominant with crops of sugar beet, cereals and some potatoes. There is also dairy farming, mainly in the lowland area. The largest settlement is Moreton with some modern housing, the church of St Mary, and a public house. The post office has now closed. Woodcote is a small community with a large hall that is now a retirement home. There are public
